title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006), hereby
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries and Maritime
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries and Maritime 

Jurisdiction (Mussel Seed) (Opening of Fisheries) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 03 September 2022 and 

shall cease to have effect on 18 December 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited sea-fisheries maritime jurisdiction (mussel seed) (opening fisheries) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall come operation 03 september 2022 shall cease effect 18 december 2022

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006), hereby
heading: In these Regulations “mussel seed” means mussels (mytilus edulis)
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “mussel seed” means mussels (mytilus edulis) 
whether alive or dead and includes any part of a mussel and the shell, or any 
part of the shell, of a mussel and which are not intended for direct human 
consumption.
text_norm: 2 regulation mussel seed mean mussel (mytilus edulis) whether alive dead includes part mussel shell part shell mussel intended direct human consumption

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006), hereby
heading: 3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), a person may fish for mussel seed in the
text_raw:
3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), a person may fish for mussel seed in the 
exclusive fishery limits of the State where that person holds an authorisation to 
fish for mussel seed granted under section 13 of the Sea-Fisheries and 
Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 or a licence granted by the relevant competent 
authority of Northern Ireland. 

(2) Paragraph (1) shall not apply to— 

(a) 

an area where fishing for mussels or mussel seed is prohibited 
by a Fisheries Natura Declaration made under Regulation 9 of 
the European Union (Birds and Natural Habitats) (Sea-fisheries) 
Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 290 of 2013) other than - 

(i) 

(ii) 

to the extent that fishing for mussel seed is permitted by a 
Castlemaine Harbour Fisheries Natura Permit, or 

areas subject to an aquaculture licence issued under the 
Fisheries (Amendment) Act 1997 (No. 23 of 1997), in 
accordance with that licence, 

(b) 

in the following geographical area– 

Latitude 52° 56.5400' N, Longitude 5° 56.6820’ W through 

Latitude 52° 56.5260' N, Longitude 5° 56.3390' W through 

Latitude 52° 56.4120' N, Longitude 5° 56.0150' W through 

Latitude 52° 55.9620' N, Longitude 5° 55.9620' W through 

Latitude 52° 56.4330' N, Longitude 5° 56.6890' W to 

the first mentioned point, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th August, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [424] 3 

(referred to as “Seapark Point exclusion zone”), and 

(c) 

the Moville Area (within the meaning of the Foyle Fisheries Act 
1952 (No. 5 of 1952)) and the Louth Area (within the meaning 
of section 31 of the British-Irish Agreement Act, 1999 (No. 1 of 
1999)) or any part thereof, if, and to the extent that mussel seed 
fishing is subject to Regulations under section 13 of the Foyle 
Fisheries Act 1952. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 August 2022. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [424]

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006), hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Regulations are to provide for the opening of the mussel seed fishery 
from 03 September 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [424] 5
